Zohran Mamdani's meteoric rise in New York signals a widespread desire for change among Democrats
subhead: The progressive candidate is now the frontrunner in New York City's mayoral election, set for November, after defeating former state governor Andrew Cuomo, a symbol of the moderate local elite, in the Democratic primary.

title: Kylian Mbappé is the big missing name at the start of the Club World Cup
subhead: The forward, who was counting on the tournament to salvage a collectively disappointing season with Real Madrid, missed his team's first two matches due to acute gastroenteritis. He remains sidelined for the clash against RB Salzburg on Thursday.
byline: By Alexandre Lemarié (Miami (Florida) and Los Angeles (California) special correspondent)

title: Lalo Schifrin, composer of the 'Mission: Impossible' theme, dies at 93
subhead: A pianist, arranger, composer and conductor, the Argentine musician also wrote the music for the television series Mannix and for films such as Bullitt, Dirty Harry and Enter the Dragon.

title: Has the Mendelssohn Stradivarius, stolen by the Nazis, been found?
subhead: An investigation by an American academic asserts the 'Small Mendelssohn,' an exceptional violin taken from the Mendelssohn family during World War II, is the same instrument as the 'Stella,' the magnificent violin currently played by Japanese virtuoso Eijin Nimura. He denies that.

subhead: By bombing Iran alongside Israel, Donald Trump has performed a show of force aimed at China and Russia, explains the director of the French Institute of International Relations in an interview.

title: 'Dating apps have every interest to turn our love lives into gruyère cheese, full of holes and short-lived misfires'
subhead: In an interview with Le Monde, Arnaud Poissonnier, author of a book examining the love industry, advocates for regulating the sector through a professional association and calls on platforms to 'completely rethink their systems.'

title: Robert Malley: 'The adversaries of the Islamic Republic of Iran would be wrong to celebrate too much'
subhead: Israel's recent military offensives in Gaza, the West Bank, Lebanon and, together with the US, in Iran, will fuel hatred of the West and a desire for revenge across the Middle East, writes Robert Malley, the lead negotiator of the 2015 Iranian nuclear deal.
